alert.note: Alert for North St. Louis; Northern Cook, Northern Lake (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 8:24PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EAST CENTRAL ST. LOUIS AND NORTHWESTERN LAKE COUNTIES THROUGH 900 PM CDT... At 823 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of Burntside Lake, or 12 miles northwest of Ely, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central St. Louis and northwestern Lake Counties, including the following locations... Crooked Lake, Fourtown Lake, Big Moose Lake and Lac la Croix. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle.

area.areaDesc: North St. Louis; Northern Cook, Northern Lake
